contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement <!-- See Template:Infobox settlement for additional fields and descriptions --> | name = Yeniçağa | image_skyline = | image_caption = | image_shield = | pushpin_map = Turkey | latd = 40 |latm = 46 |lats = |latNS = N | longd = 32 |longm = 01 |longs = |longEW = E | coordinates_display = inline,title | coordinates_format = dms | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = [[Turkey]] | subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of Turkey|Province]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Bolu Province|Bolu]] | subdivision_type2 = | subdivision_name2 = | leader_party = | leader_title = <!-- Mayor --> | leader_name = | leader_title1 = <!-- [[Kaymakam]] --> | leader_name1 = | elevation_m = | area_footnotes = {{Turkey district areas|SOURCE}} | area_blank1_title = District | area_blank1_km2 = {{Turkey district areas|Bolu|Yeniçağa}} | population_footnotes = {{Turkey district populations|SOURCE|Bolu}} | population_urban = {{Turkey district populations|Bolu|Yeniçağa|şehir}} | population_as_of = {{Turkey district populations|YEAR}} | population_blank1_title = District | population_blank1 = {{Turkey district populations|Bolu|Yeniçağa|toplam}} | population_density_blank1_km2 = auto | postal_code_type = <!-- Post code --> | postal_code = | website = <!-- {{URL|XXXXXXX|XXXXXX}} --> }} '''Yeniçağa''' is a town and a district of [[Bolu Province]] in the [[Black Sea Region, Turkey|Black Sea]] region of [[Turkey]], 38 km from the town of [[Bolu]], on the highway from [[Istanbul]] to [[Ankara]]. It covers an area of 225 km², and the population (2000) is 10,800 of which 5,953 live in the town of Yeniçağa. Elevation is about 1200 m. The mayor is Ahmet Kızıltan ([[Felicity Party|SP]]). The district is on the inland side of Bolu Mountain and has a cold, hard, dry inland climate; the countryside is pine-forested on the northern and western parts of the district whereas the south-eastern parts are sparsely wooded hills. Yeniçağa is a small town providing basic infrastructure to the surrounding countryside, and successive generations have migrated to large cities in Turkey or abroad in search of jobs and careers. There are a large number of roadside restaurants, gas stations and repair shops along the old E5 Istanbul highway, these are mainly used by trucks as cars zoom by on the newer [[TEM motorway]]. Yeniçağa Lake is a popular spot for picnics under the trees on the lakeshore.
